ygData.messageBody:
Jynxx,

I agree with what you are saying but i seriously doubt that verant would add
anythig like 6 attacks per round. IF they DID do that it wouldnt be with a
warrior and that makes sense to me, it would most probably be a monk thing
seeing as how they are much faster and agile. But what verant should do as
you said is increase the damage that we go, and consistency that we hit at.
I mean cmon, a level 37 warrior should not miss more that once per round
dont you think? like you said we are trained in combat therefore we shouldnt
miss, and should do more damage. But i think the more multiple attacks is
asking a bit much. The least Verant could do is increase tha damage we do on
a higher basis per level with some kind of weapon mastery skill.

Example:

Verant creates a type of specializatsion thing like casters get except
warriors get to pick from 1h , 2h shlashing, blunt and peircinfg. Say we get
it at level 20, sounds fair, at that level we are becoming mighty warriors.

So we go to our trainer and pracitse that specialization. THe more it goes
up the better bonus we get while using that weapon class. (Like the bonus a
rogue gets for using a peircing weapon but better.) Then as well after level
20 we could get our damage up like 5 pts a level or something....

well something like that anyway.

> size=2>Ok...sorry...should have added on to that. The critical hit is
> nice, although I can definetly see monks getting that as well since they
> pretty much are supposed to know all the nerve points and such on a body.
> Also....let's try this on for size. Warriors need to get a BIG bonus on
> damage, not just every other round or so. We are fighting machines. Why,
> if I am level 45, should I not be able to be trained so well that I attack
> 6 times in one round? I know my sword, I know my enemy, and I know where
> to hit and how many times. I think we should get more attacks, more
> damage, AND critical hits. We should at least be on damage somewhat
> compareable to a spell caster. People are going to argue...."But they use
> magic! How can a sword stroke compare to the Art?" Well...when I take my
> 2-handed sword and chop off someone's head before you even get one
> syllable of a spell out of your mouth, the argument will be over. Lets
> face it...an object is an object. Sure a lightning strike MIGHT hurt more
> than getting hit with a double bladed axe right in your groin, but I
> personally have never been struck by either so who am I to say? It just
> seems to me that I should be able to hurt someone with a physical weapon
> actually hitting them just as much as someone hurling balls of fire at
> them. Grrrr.....this point is getting frustrating.</FONT></DIV>
